New Records: Since FIFA began its world rankings, no side has beaten an opponent as many places above it as Slovakia (48th) beating Belgium (second)
Key Match Events: Ivan Schranz scored the winning goal for Slovakia after intercepting a pass from Jeremy Doku
Romelu Lukaku had two goals disallowed by VAR
Belgium equalised with a goal from Romelu Lukaku in the 56th minute but was denied by VAR again
Slovakia defended well and recorded their biggest win since beating Italy in the 2010 World Cup

Post-Match Reflections: Domenico Tedesco refused to criticise officials after Belgium's loss to Slovakia
The Red Devils will still back themselves to qualify for the last 16, but they have put themselves under pressure and looked a long way from contention
Belgium's golden generation have aged, and they need to change things, such as freshening up their XI with young players and changing their mindset
Miscellaneous Highlights: Lukas Haraslin was a constant menace for Slovakia, and his enterprise and devil set the tone for the team's performance
